reviews.review: Come non amare questo gioco......anche se avrà i suoi anni resta sempre una pietra miliare. E anche dopo anni giocarci nuovamente rivivendo la storia, che è a dir poco stupenda, è incredibile.

I recently played through HL:Source and I forgot how great a game it is. It certainly withstands the test of time and multiple replays. If you've never played it you're in for a treat. Levels are intuitively designed, voice acting is good, combat (if you're playing on hard) is intense and requires some quick movement and reflexes. Tiny little additions like the missle guiding system relieve the tedium of shootin'. Must play.
great game

For a FPS that was released in 1998, it must have been amazing. On the down side the platforming segments are annoying and Freeman (the man character) walks/runs like he is always on ice. This game was definitely s ground breaker for the FPS genre and the updated graphics gives the game a clean looking style.

Recreation of the original Half Life using the source engine. Graphically looks better, and bunny hopping still exists.

Incredible game. Great gameplay and plot, pretty long. A classic everyone should play at least once. The graphics got a bit outdated, but the Source version makes them look better. The physics are also very good thanks to the engine. And you can play it in Full HD (1920x1080)!

"Half-Life: Source is Half-Life ported to the Source engine," said Captain Obvious. Valve took everything I loved about the original Half-Life: the excellent and capitivating story, the brilliant enemy AI, the polished gunplay, and the at times mind boggling puzzles, and shoved it into a slightly prettier package with sharper textures, not-so-HD models (that, while clearly not HD, look better than the original), cleaner particle effects, death ragdolls, and water that actually looks like water. I recommend this game to anyone who does not have the original, as it is the superior version. However, I can't recommend this game to anyone who does own the original unless they own Garry's Mod- since this game is in the Source engine, you can mount it in Gmod and use props and NPCS from the game. The only downside is you can't use original Half-Life mods like Half-Life Zombie Edition or Natural Selection, as they weren't designed for the Source engine. For those, you need the original game.
Half Life is a game
It has source engine, and source engine makes the graphics better. Trust me, when you get into battle, this will be like Half-Life 2.

Which is better, Half-Life or the Source version? Well, that depends on what your willing to deal with between the two. Half-Life Source looks quite a bit better than the origanal with its water effects, motion blur, and fixed box-pushing machanic. However, unlike the origanal, Source DOES NOT have an auto save! So you could progress throu the entire game, die right at the end, and start over at that damn long tram ride. Another thing to mention is the enimies just love to get right in your face, so be perpared to use you shotgun alot. As long as your willing to deal with that, and have a habit of pressing the F6 key, then go ahead and get Half-Life Source. Otherwise, just stick with regular Half-Life.

*Note: In case anyone hasn't played a Valve game before, F6 is the manuel save.

*****

gordon freeman turns up late for work, ruins microwaved dinners, ignores every single person he sees, and then opens a massive portal, letting a metric fuckton of hostile creatures make their way directly to an unprepared earth. you may not be able to hear it, but he's laughing to himself the entire time. gordon freeman is essentially a massive troll, and he doesn't give a shit what you think. 

also the game is pretty decent, give it a go.

Half Life Source is amazing. I first picked it up last year and I loved it. I still love it. However I'm playing it again now and I'm experiencing a TON of bugs. Like in the part in Residue Processing with all the conveyar belts the map is really glitching out making a bunch of things I clearly don't remember seeing making it really hard to navigate. Another is the securrity guard from blast pit who yells "EAT LEAD YOU OUTERSPACE OCTOPUS!" doesn't get killed from whatever that thing is called making it not pay attention at all to you etc. I'm not saying this is a bad game at all in fact I highly reccomend it it's just it kind of needs to be fixed up a bit.

Einer der größten Klassiker den es gibt. Half Life hat das Shooter Genre einfach revolutioniert und gehört ganz kalr zu den besten Spielen aller Zeiten. Die Story um den Black Mesa Mitarbeiter Gordan Freeman ist richtig toll erzählt und das sogar ohne Cutscenes. Das Gameplay ist auch toll. Die Shooter Elemente fühlen sich toll an und dazu gibt es noch Jump & Run und Rätselelemte die das Spiel so besonders machen. Dazu lässt der mysteriose G-Man und das Ende noch viel Platz für Spekulationen. Das Spiel ist einfach genial und wird nur noch von seinem Nachfolger übertroffen!

Its been years since I've watched my Dad go through this game, and I've finally found time to truely tackle it.

Some gameplays elements are obviously incredibly outdated, but the game is very good up until the 'Xen' alien home world section, where for some reason, the game takes a nose dive.

I can see why this is on so many people's best games of all time list.

For a game that came out like what, 14 years ago? The controls feel solid and the AI are intelligint. The game also seems wonderful for people who like to explore. This game could ocmpete with shooters released to this day. Everything feels solid. 

Now onward to Half Life 2!!!

Básicamente es lo mismo que el original, pero con su física (las articulaciones de los bichitos se mueven cuando están muertos y tal), el movimiento de las armas, las texturas, el sonido de impacto en materiales de los suelos y de las paredes y los gráficos del agua están completamente cambiados.

Te lo recomiendo SOLO si no tienes el Half Life 1 original y / o lo quieres para añadir nuevo contenido a Garry's Mod.

Lo malo es eso, que no haya tantos cambios como los gráficos.
¡Lo bueno es que es un clásico renacido, por fin de vuelta!

8.2 / 10

Revive la aventura de Half-Life, una de las mejores, pero esta vez con texturas nuevas y mejoradas junto algún que otro efecto no incluido en el Half-Life original. Aunque este Half-Life sigue usando el motor GoldScr aunque algo mejorado, puedes disfrutar de la física de Half-Life 2 dado a que ha sido implementado el motor físico Havok haciendo el juego un poco más díficil que el original pero con la misma realidad que en Half-Life 2 y una IA mucho más mejorada que en el primitivo Half-Life. Lástima que con Source solo se refieran a la implementación física y no al motor gráfico para jugarlo con la misma calidad que Half-Life 2, sus episodios y Portal.

Although the graphics aren't anything to brag about (even in the port to the Source engine), the gameplay is still the same crazyness its predecessor brought. A storyline worth wonders put out piece by piece, an always low supply of ammunition, and the kind of difficulty that isn't too difficult, but will kill you at any chance is just perfect. Blend that in with the fact that there are THREE "factions" (Black Mesa, the U.S. Army, and the Aliens) that are constantly warring and you have one heck of a great game.
El FPS que cambió todo! Todo aquel que le gusten mínimamente los juegos debe jugarlo.

Spielerisch nach wie vor sehr guter Ego-Shooter, welcher sich vor allem durch schnelles, flüssiges Gameplay und durchdachtes Leveldesign auszeichnet. Optisch wird das Spiel in der Source-Version durch verbesserte Licht-/Wassereffekte und Physik aufgewertet, zudem läuft das Spiel in 16:9, 1080p. Trotzdem sollte man keine grafischen Wunder erwarten, das Spiel bleibt nahe am Original von 1998, denn Polygoncount von Umgebung/Charakteren bleibten größtenteils identisch. Die deutsche Version verfügt statt menschlicher Gegner über Roboter, was mich im Gegensatz zur mangelhaften Sprachausgabe nicht groß gestört hat. Einige der letzten Level erreichen nicht ganz die Klasse der vorherigen. Spieldauer: Etwa 20 Stunden.

Meine Wertung: 8.0 von 10 Punkten

Valve makes really good games. Not this game. This game is glitchy and looks like crap. The physics don't fit the props, and the player doesn't fit the game. The best possible thing I can say about this game is that the water looks nice. Worst port ever and the best company did it. Great job, Valve.
물그래픽이 좋아진 기분?!

Having played both the original and Source versions, I personally prefer the original. You can see a minor improvement to the lighting and water effects, but the textures don't appear to be enhanced in anyway. There are also minor quirks, such as the sluggish tram ride at the start, that indicate to me that this was really just a something for Vale to put out on the market when the Half Life 2 release was delayed, pushing back the true introduction to what the Source engine could do. HL1 remains an awesome game, for me a hair more entertaining than HL2, but there's no real value in picking up this Source edition if you already own the standard GoldSource edition. Grab the expansions instead, if you don't already have them, or Half Life 2.

Игра Half-Life 1 ставшей революционной с приключением физика-теоретика Гордона Фримена в научно-исследовательском комплексе "Черная Меза", до сих пор остаётся одной из самых лучших игр всех времен. Однако, Half-Life: Source не совсем то, что хотели видеть фанаты игры, физика и модель воды была взята из Half-Life 2, а текстуры все же из HL1. Моя оценка  9/10.

In this game, you realize, very quickly, that Half-Life: Source is incredibly buggy, but the charm comes from the bugs, lighting errors, and weird ragdoll physics, so, it's kind of okay. I like it. That's all that should matter really, and there are tons of mods made for it, so, get it for those, really.

Возрождённая Half-Life, чуть приукрашенная, но это всё таже игра. Play it! Enjoy it!

A fantastic FPS tha focuses more on the adventure than simply getting kills. The game never cuts away to cutscenes, instead having the story and events happening around you as you play. I miss when PFS games were like this. Health doesn't regenerate, you can carry every weapon at once, etc. But that may make the game feel strange to those raised on modern FPS games. But this game is still loads of fun today. Pick up the Source version for various tweaks to the game.
